page.title: 13CLEANING UP HOUNSLOW,MOGDEN
page.content: The{West Middlesex Drainage Works, } known locally as Mogden Sewage Works, is situated adjacent to{Redlees Park} in Isleworth.The sewage works occupies an area of{approx.1Km square}& provides purification facilities for over 1 Million people.It houses one of the most advanced treatment processes in Western Europe & the resulting water,which is released into the Thames,is said to be good enough to drink.The solid bi-product of the process is sold as fertiliser called Mogdenite.This represents 1% of the effluent entering the works.The area surrounding the works is landscaped & the local residents would hardly realise Mogden existed except for a slight odour when the works is upwind of them.It is a popular venue for school visits & is regularly used by Biologists to enhance their teaching.
